name: Setup instructions
info:
Complete following steps before using weather flow.

 * Create account at https://openweathermap.org and generate the API key.
 * Set API key in `prepare request` function nodes.
 * Set API key in `Weather provider` configuration of `current-weather` node.
 * Go to your Twilio account and configure chosen webhook.

To test the flow use existing postal code in Germany, e.g. 12524 for Berlin.

name: prepare request
process request
<Say> template
template:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Response>
    <Say voice="alice" language="en-US">Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.</Say>
</Response>

name: prepare request
process request
<Message> template
template:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Response>
    <Message>
        <Body>Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.</Body>
    </Message>
</Response>

text: Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.

name: Weather message
text: Welcome to the weather information service. Please provide postal code of the city in Germany to hear the information about current temperature in this city.

name: Current weather
text: Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.
